paper_abstract: We prove the following theorem for the q-gamma function Gamma(q)(x): (q;q)(infinity)(1-q)(1-x)(e)Sigma(infinity)(i=0)f(q(x+i)) < Gamma(q)(x) < (q;q)(infinity)(1-q)(1-x)(e)Sigma(infinity)(i=0)g(q(x+i)), where x > 0, 0 < q < 1 and f (x), g (x) are two positive functions pass through the point of origin such that 0 < f' (x) < 1/1-x < g' (x); for 0 <= x < 1. As consequences of this result we will refine some recent results and we will present the following double inequality of Gamma(q) (x) in terms of the q-digamma function psi(q)(x) for x> 0 and 0 < q < 1: (q;q)(infinity)(1-q)(1-x)(1/logq[psi q(x+log(3/4)/log q)+log(1-q)])(e) < Gamma(q)(x) < (q;q)(infinity)(1-q)(1-xe1/logq[psi q(x)+log(1-q)]).
paper_title: Refinement of some inequalities of q-gamma function
